info.name: Supercar-Trader
info.description:
> **This collection was made as part of the AppDynamics Enablement program in 2022**

# Supercar Trader

Supercar Trader is a Java-based Web Application

The purpose of Supercar-Trader collection is to generate dynamic traffic (business transactions) for AppDynamics Controller.

---

## Getting Started

The Supercar Trader collection contains a total of **74** HTTP requests (**69** `GET` requests and **5** `POST` requests)

Pages: `3 requests`
Supercars Pages: `10 requests`
Search Page: `3 requests`
Car Pages: `24 requests`
Car Pages - View Enquiry: `24 requests`
Sell Page: `3 requests` (_1 POST request should throw an Error to the Controller_)
Enquire Page: `2 requests`
jsp Pages: `5 requests`

## How to use?

Import both `Supercar-Trader.postman_collection.json` and `Supercar-Trader Environment.postman_environment.json`, and select `Supercar-Trader Environment` to be in use (from the upper right corner. The `No Environment` dropdown)

Edit the `ip` variable in `Supercar-Trader Environment` with the IP address of your Supercar Trader web application and save it.

To run the entire collection at once (all 25 HTTP requests), click on `Runner` located at the bottom right corner, drag/drop the collection in the `Runner window` as instructed, then click `Start Run`.

## Notes

- All POST requests use dynamic variables that change every time the collection is started to avoid performing redundant POST requests with the same values.

- All requests are tested and passed the test to be considered successful, even for the request with error.

item.name: Pages
item.description:
# Pages

1. Home Page `/home.do`
2. About page `/about.do`
3. Insurance Page `/insurance.do`

item.name: Supercars Pages
item.description:
# Supercars Pages

Supercars `/supercars.do`

01. Porsche `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=1`
02. Ferrari `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=2`
03. Aston Martin `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=3`
04. BMW `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=4`
05. Mercedes Benz `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=5`
06. Jaguar `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=6`
07. Lamborghini `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=7`
08. Lotus `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=8`
09. McLaren `/cars.do?query=manu&mid=9`

item.name: Search Page

request.description:
# POST request

Dynamically searches for different cars every request using Postman `Pre-request Scripts`

item.description:
# Search

1. Search Page is a GET request.

2. Search for a car requires a single body key-value pair `criteria`. Example key is `criteria` and its value is `Ferrari`. 

3. Find all cars searches for all cars with no criteria.

> Body type has to be `x-www-form-urlencoded` in both POST requests.

item.name: Car Pages
Mercedes AMG GT R PRO V8

request.description: # Mercedes AMG GT R PRO V8

item.description:
# Cars

In search page, if you click `search` with empty input field, all results are fetched from the database. Each car has a unique ID. This folder contains all default cars in Supercar Trader.

item.name: Sell Page

exec: pm.expect(responseText).to.include("Thanks for selling through Supercars trader. Your enquiry will be passed on to seller.");
// select a manufacturer ID and a car model
// generates a random year between 2015 and current year

urlencoded.value: Leather seats, Power Steering, Air Conditioning, Intelligent parking system, Remote Keyless, Electric mirrors, Front Power Windows, Back Power Windows, Tinted Glass, Multifunction sound system, AUX, USB ports, Bluetooth, Rear sensors, EPS, Side Airbag, ABS, EBD, Sensors, Driver Airbag, Anti - theft System, Front sensors, Passenger Airbag
urlencoded.description: Detailed Description (String) or use {{$randomLoremParagraphs}} global variable for placeholder text

request.description:
# POST request

Dynamically generates `manufacturer`, `carModel`, `carEngine`, `carColor`, `carYear`, `carPrice`, and `carSummary` using Postman `Pre-request Scripts`

exec: pm.test("Sell Form Submitted with Error", function() {

request.description:
# POST request

Submit an empty body to throw an error

item.description:
# Sell Page

1. `Sell page` is a GET request.
2. `Sell a car` is a POST request where eight key-value pairs are required for a successful POST request.
- `manufacturer` is an integer (number)
- `carModel` is a string (text)
- `carEngine` is a string (text)
- `carColor` is a string (text)
- `carYear` is an integer (number)
- `carPrice` is an integer (number)
- `carSummary` is a string (text)
- `carDetails` is a string (text)

> Body type has to be `x-www-form-urlencoded` in the POST requests.

item.name: Enquire Page

urlencoded.description: A Random Full Name or Your Name
A Random Email or Your Email

request.description:
# POST request

Dynamically generates random `name`, `email` and `comment`.

item.description:
# Enquire Pages

1. Enquire page is a GET request

2. Submit an Enquiry is a POST request where it requires three input fields.

- Name `name`
- Email `email`
- Description `comment`

> Car is a read-only input field (`carName`).

request.description:
# GET request

Mazda Speed JSP Page

item.description:
# jsp Pages

JSP pages are five JavaServer Pages that can be found at the Home page under **`Performance Parts`** in the right sidebar.
